@Lagneia Von Voploshchenny I like "reverse NTR" because I'm a degenerate pervert and the idea of some sex-deprived gyaru slut being so horny she is willing to fuck a shota manages to fire off my cumbrain neurons in a way that nothing else does. It has nothing to do with being a hypocrite. I would prefer no NTR. But if there is going to be NTR, I'd rather it be the "reverse" variety because at least that triggers the coomer instincts in me. The other issue is 98.7% of anything tagged NTR contains fat ugly smelly bastards. I don't wanna see some disgusting ugly fucko slobber all over some girl, man. It's that simple. But a gyaru preying on a shota, or at the very least, teasting the ever loving shit out of some dorky virgin? Fuck yeah, sign me the fuck up. I WANT THAT TO HAPPEN TO ME. PLEASE. People who dislike NTR because of the cheating/story aspect are mentally ill though. If you care about that you're insane. It's just a drawing bro god damn.

@Crimsonalley About the personal offenses you directed at me, I won't say anything because you look a little crazy lol, but I'm not trying to be a white knight trying to say what people should like or dislike on a pornographic website (even because, like you even said, I have some tastes that are frowned upon by society). I literally just wanted to quote an ironic fact about how people selectively behave towards the NTR. That's it ... You don't have to turn this into a war. Calm down gentleman

@Crimsonalley Jesus man, you need to chill. All this writing could be avoided if you had read the first sentence of my comment, where I say that I like NTR in general. I didn't ask anyone to empathize with the girl being cheated on, nor did I even ask them to hate the reverse NTR, I just cited a funny fact about how people who claim to be "NTR haters", "haters of betrayal stories", really just they hate it when the man is being betrayed and when the opposite happens, they don't care.
But I admit that I was stupid to say that all men are hypocrites. That was a mistake and I apologize for that... it's not even what I really think, it was just the wrong way to write it. Don't mistake me for some annoying feminist or something.
